name: Zulú Burá
messages: You enter a small sandstone room.
There's a humidity in the air, but you're glad to finally be out of the desert sun.
Sand covers the floor, remnants of past storms that have plagued the region.
Two identical corridors lie ahead of you.

rooms.name: left hall
messages: You walk down the left corridor as the sands give way to solid stone floors.
Light becomes more scarce so you light a torch to discover ancient glyphs adorning the walls.

rooms.name: burial room
messages: Jars resembling strange beasts lay discarded by a large sarcophagus in the center of the room.
The entire room's ceiling is considerably lower than that of the entrance, and it smells of thousand-year-old decay.
The sarcophagus creaks open, and an ancient horror emerges from it to rend you to pieces.

rooms.name: cursed altar
messages: You leave the stench of death behind you as you crouch through the low doorway into the next room.
The room's ceiling hangs much higher than the last, and a black stone obelisk with crackling purple glyphs dominates the center of the space.
You're deep into the dungeon at this point, but with a faint wind you hear a booming voice call "Who dares disturb my slumber?".
The glyphs on the monument crackle with an even fiercer energy, and they begin to cast lightning bolts at you.

rooms.name: treasure room
messages: You notice a large crack in the wall behind the shattered remains of the sentient obelisk.
A golden glow emanates from the damaged wall.
With some effort you force the failing stone wall to crumble, leading to a bright room ful to the brim with golden treasures from a time long past.
You loot all you can and buy yourself a mansion.

rooms.name: right hall
messages: You proceed through the right corridor when you're ambushed by a giant scarab beetle.

rooms.name: small chamber
messages: You get to the end of the hall and proceed into a small chamber on your left.
It is dimly lit, but torches on the wall light up as you enter.
The door slams behind you as you stare at the room's inhabitants in shock and horror.
It would seem the architects of Zulú Burá valued prehistoric beasts, as two scaly man-eating raptors stare back at you with slavering jaws agape.

rooms.name: royal burial chamber
messages: You step over the hides of two pre-human horrors and towards the far wall.
An engraving there matches one you had seen previously in the bazaar not far from this dungeon.
It translates to "the way shall be marked with blood", a favorite saying of an ancient revivalist warlord infamous in the region's lore.
You walk back to the raptor carcasses and dip your hand in the pool of ruby-red blood forming beside them.
Smearing this on the engraved wall, a door open up to you. It is the ancient burial chamber of the mad king Zelpharos.
You pilfer his final belongings and live in extreme wealth for the rest of your days.

rooms.name: narrow tunnel
messages: You crawl through a small hole at the end of the hallway.
It leads through a downward tunnel that ends in a large torch-lit room about 50 feet below the room you were just in.
You cannot attempt to climb back up, for a giant serpent with madness in its eyes stares at you from the other side of the room.

rooms.name: staircase
messages: Stairs are revealed behind a stone slab that slides from the wall behind the dead remains of the serpent god.
You follow the stairs upwards until it ends in a small room with a treasure chest.
You open the chest, freeing a small Djin.
"Thank you," the Djinn says. "Now I may return to my realm."
The Djinn blesses you with a charm of wealth attraction and whisks you back to your home.
